citations.narrative:
Structural strength. There are holes in the floor in house # 2 by the overhead door entrance. Holes in floor of animal
rooms can allow the entrance of rodents and other pests. Housing facilities for guinea pigs must be structurally sound and
maintained in good repair to prevent other animals from entering. Correct by May 22, 2023.

There were accumulations of brown debris and dirty bedding by some of the automatic water valves and the PVC
drainpipes in house # 2 especially in the lower enclosures on the racks. The accumulations around water valves and
drainpipes can expose the guinea pigs to potential disease infection with bacterial, fungi, and parasites. Water
receptacles such as automatic delivery lines must be cleaned and sanitized whenever dirty and at least once every 2
weeks. Inadequate cleaning of the automatic water valves and drainpipes can result in contamination of the guinea pigs in
the same enclosure and located in lower enclosures from those above. Correct by May 9, 2023.
This inspection was conducted with the licensee and the exit interview was conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.25(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Structural strength.  There are holes in the floor in house # 2 by the overhead door entrance. Holes in floor of animal 
rooms can allow the entrance of rodents and other pests. Housing facilities for guinea pigs must be structurally sound and 
maintained in good repair to prevent other animals from entering. Correct by May 22, 2023. 
3.30 
   
Watering. 
There were accumulations of brown debris and dirty bedding by some of the automatic water valves and the PVC 
drainpipes in house # 2 especially in the lower enclosures on the racks. The accumulations around water valves and 
drainpipes can expose the guinea pigs to potential disease infection with bacterial, fungi, and parasites. Water 
receptacles such as automatic delivery lines must be cleaned and sanitized whenever dirty and at least once every 2 
weeks. Inadequate cleaning of the automatic water valves and drainpipes can result in contamination of the guinea pigs in 
the same enclosure and located in lower enclosures from those above. Correct by May 9, 2023. 
 
This inspection was conducted with the licensee and the exit interview was conducted with the facility representative.
